Reviews.Title: Nice tv for small rooms!
Reviews.Author: Joe Consumer
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Samsung LN22A450 after considering many other models in the Samsung lineup (the 19" version of this set as well as the 6 series version).  I found that the 19" was still a bit too small for my liking, and the 6 series did not have enough improvements over this model to warrant the $90 increase in cost (the LN22A650 was on sale at a local store for $550).  I ended up buying this television for $460 from amazon, and I am very happy with my decision.  The tv is a perfect size for my small bedroom, and the picture quality is superior to many other brands that I have seen.Pros:-Built in digital tuner can be used to receive FREE HD channels via OTA broadcasts when connected to an antenna (almost all hdtv's have this, but it's an important feature to note if you don't want to pay for cable)-PC input (VGA) can be used to connect a laptop for viewing streaming or downloaded internet content-Picture quality (free HD channels are amazing, and upconverted DVDs are also great)-Aesthetics of the tv set itself (it looks pretty slick when paired up with a matching upconverting dvd player, the Samsung DVD-F1080 1080p Upconverting Compact DVD Player)Cons:-Only 1 HDMI input-VGA instead of DVI input for PC-SRS "surround sound" is disappointing; I just keep it turned off and turn up the volumeDespite the few complaints, I still give this product 5 stars, because samsung seems to have gotten all the more important details right with this tv.  You can't really expect to get impressive sound from hidden speakers that are pointed downwards, though the quality is good enough for a small room.  Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: A bit more expected from this
Reviews.Author: Gauda
Reviews.Content: I'll preface by saying I'm not a serious A/V person, I'm not up to speed on the latest and greatest technology - just a layman. My old CRT TV died, and I needed a new one. Wanted LCD for the lower power consumption and since nearly all of them are HD ready I wanted that too. From what I read, Samsung has the best LCD panels out there. The image on this one is extremely good, though in my opinion I wouldn't say excellent. At times it seems to blur momentarily. Colors are well represented. The features of the TV are nice, not much more than you'd find with older CRT though. This unit is very light weight and easily mounted to a wall. It doesn't get hot when on, which is nice. The remote is weird in its layout of the buttons. I guess it's a subjective thing, but the channel and volume up/down buttons are at the bottom of the remote, not the top and that's really annoying to me. Good thing I was able to get a universal to use with my cable box and DVD player. While I would otherwise give it a five star rating I will have to agree with many others about my one real gripe. The sound. The speakers are buried UNDER the TV, and point down. I have mine in a small bedroom, I don't have delusions of using this TV for a home theater but for four hundred bucks they could have put some better speakers on this thing. While the speakers are loud enough, they just don't sound all that great most of the time.

Reviews.Title: Great little tv
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Susan McIntyre"
Reviews.Content: I agonized over this purchase since there were such mixed reviews.  This tv is wonderful.  It works perfectly and has a good picture.  I don't know what people find wrong with the sound.  I guess I don't have discerning ears.

Reviews.Title: Great Tv
Reviews.Author: Mike Fleming "gadget guy"
Reviews.Content: When I needed to upgrade the TV in our kitchen, it had to fit in a cabinet-end box that had been designed for a 20" CRT Sony 10 years ago.  I soon learned that few HDTV mfgrs are building HDTVs that are 22 - 23". After a lot of web research and viewing and measuring LCD and plasma TVs in retailers, we agreed that the 22-inch Samsung was the best for us.  While it's widely available in many retail outlets and sites, Amazon's price was the best. It was delivered in just a few days and the set has a beautiful picture and "fits" our needs perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Distorted sound
Reviews.Author: P. Mitchell "pwmpci"
Reviews.Content: I am now sending my second LN22A451 back as the sound becomes distorted for a few seconds then corrects itself.  Seems odd that I'd get 2 with the same problem.  I didn't think I connected it wrong...cable in , and plug it in, no cable box, no receiver, no DVD, etc!  The picture was great but I just didn't want to take the chance of it failing.  I hooked another Samsung LNT1923H into the cable and there was no issue with the sound, indicating to me that it is not the fault of the cable signal.  Oh well.  Good luck with yours.

Reviews.Title: Picture is okay, Sound is terrible!
Reviews.Author: Bigmac
Reviews.Content: A little harder to setup than our LG 26" but a good picture nonetheless.Where this set loses points is in sound quality.  For some reason Samsung can't get sound right in their sets.  The speakers sound about as powerful as an alarm clock.  They are absolutely awful!We decided to get the LG26LG30 instead, and we're not disappointed.  Sound is powerful and picture is vibrant, with great detail.  With the Samsung I found I was straining just to hear it!

Reviews.Title: A smart choice for this size
Reviews.Author: Mont Claire
Reviews.Content: I am very picky when it comes to electronics. I spend 2-3 months reading and visiting different stores asking lots of questions to a variety of salesman. Honestly I am a die-hard SONY consumer, but SONY did not have a set this size, needed for a spare bedroom. Having a friend who is a tv repairman, I was influenced somewhat by his opinion, as he sees sets all the time in the store for repair. According to him, the three brands that have the LEAST repairs are ...SONY, SAMSUNG and PANASONIC. He says "you can't go wrong with any of those brands." I have to believe him. This set is excellent. The set up is a breeze, and the picture on standard cable is very good, HD is amazing. The prize at AMAZON is cheaper than any of the big box stores, but just so you know, if you just have to have it NOW, and can't wait a few days for shipping, HH Greggs will match the price within about $4.00, whereas Circuit City and Best Buy thumb their noses at you when you ask. They are just too big for their britches! That's about it...if you are looking for a set in this size, just go buy it. It's a super looking set, easy controls, easy set up, very good picture on cable, excellent on HD and a good price. What's not to like?

Reviews.Title: Great Picture but not true 16:9
Reviews.Author: M. Walizer
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic TV.  Great picture.  Very bright.  It needs a tilt stand, however.  Additionally, the screen is just slightly shy of a true 16:9 size, so you have to use the "wide" setting to fill the screen.  The 16:9 setting results in thin black bars on the top and bottom.

Reviews.Title: great TV - bad sound
Reviews.Author: T. jeffers
Reviews.Content: we love the TV - except for the wretched sound.  i had read the reviews that mentioned the poor sound, but didn't think it would be that bad.  we hung the TV in the kitchen and don't have a stereo to hook it up to there.

Reviews.Title: I sent this one back.....
Reviews.Author: Daniel P. Ayo
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan os Samsung. I own 2 large monitors and a small LCD. But this one went back. The viewing angle on this TV is poor. I wanted to use this for our bed room. It sits on our dresser, so we have to look up at it when laying in bed. The screen was an ugly gray and black in dark scenes. It was terrible. If you view the TV from straight on it may be OK. I found the Sony Bravia much nicer and no viewing angle problems.I had no problems returning through Amazon. There were great.....and that is why I make many purchases with them.

Reviews.Title: A Quality Product With a Few Flaws
Reviews.Author: R. Crane
Reviews.Content: I always read customer reviews before purchasing a product, and before I bought this Samsung TV, I looked at all customer reviews for all 22" flat screen TVs. I own another small Samsung and it works very well in the kitchen. What I liked most about it was the clear picture and the footprint and how little space it occupied, so I decided that another Samsung would be a good choice.  Ignoring the warning echos in other reviews, I thought this would be the ideal TV.What other reviewers mentioned was absoutely on target.  Information about the channel or anything else is so small and stays on the screen so briefly, that it is almost impossible to read.  Worst display I have ever seen.  I discovered that if you push the "info" button the display remains on the screen, but I have to cross the room to read it, as the print is still very small.  What were they thinking when they designed this display?Further, other reviews warned that if you were not directly sitting in front of the TV, you saw only black.  Having never had that experience before, I took that with a grain of salt.  Wrong.  The other reviewers are right. If you move even slightly away from the center of the set, all you can see is a black screen.  I have no idea why this is the case, but it is true. So, if you plan on using this set where you sit in front of it, with no one else in the room watching from a different angle, it works just great. If multiple people plan on watching together, you might have a problem.On the positive side, the footprint is sleek and takes little room.  The picture is very good (not as awesome as my Sony Bravia) but very clear. The design of the set itself is pleasing and the remote is comfortable to hold and fairly easy to control. You must, however, read the instruction booklet to understand some of the features (e.g. "tools" and the bottom colored buttons. Their use is not immediately obvious.)Some reviewers criticized the sound as "tinny", and I know what they mean.  It is not particularly annoying to me but if you are "into" audio, it might drive you crazy.Samsung produces a quality product, it will work for my needs, but this TV is not for everyone.

Reviews.Title: Just OK
Reviews.Author: MMPEE
Reviews.Content: I read on Consumersearch.com that Samsung had the BEST small screen LCD TV (19") and a couple of best buys in the larger LCD TV's.  So I figured that Samsung would be the best way to go for the size I wanted, 22".I read the reviews on Amazon.com and was a little concerned, but went ahead an bought it anyway as my old 20" tube TV was on the fritz and I needed to upgrade to a digital tuner before Feb of next year anyway due to the change over to digital transmission.I would have to say I agree with most of the other posts on this forum.  The sound from the little speakers pointing straight down is not great.  I will probably eventually get some better speakers to plug in.  Also as noted in other posts, if you sit below eye level of the screen the picture gets darker, if you sit above eye level of the screen it gets lighter.  Viewing from extreme angles to the right or left is not great either.As I don't watch that much TV and I have tilted the screen so that it is 'eye level' when I am sitting on my couch it will fill my modest needs, but I am not thrilled with the product.  Makes me want to go back to a CRT TV in the future, if any are still made.The Amazon price was great, much cheaper than anything I could find in my local big box retailer stores and it arrived a day earlier than predicted and in excellent shape.It would be nice if Samsung made the mounting stand adjustable so you could tilt the screen up/down/right/left to adjust for optimal viewing pleasure.

Reviews.Title: Close viewing of TV
Reviews.Author: Ronald Diprima
Reviews.Content: The Samsung 22A450 22-inch 720 P LCD HDTV,Black:I wanted a quality TV to watch while on the treadmill. This to me was the perfect choice. It's the perfect size for close viewing since my treadmill is in the laundry room . The sound it produces is a little on the "tinny" side but you get used to it in no time at all, then it's fine.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Picture Quality; Love It !!
Reviews.Author: S. Brown
Reviews.Content: I really wanted a SONY but their choices for a smaller unit (like 22inches) was small to none.  I have been using this TV for about 4 months now. After researching for months I finally decided to try the Samsung and I am not disappointed.  It has incredible picture quality and truly for a 22inch you do not need a 1080 (leave that for 32 inch and up). For the reviews you see about bad picture quality, that may be true for AIR stations but not for the digital ones.  Since we are switching to digital, who cares about the AIR stations?  FYI - I don't have cable so I am reviewing this based on stright digital signals.  Although you can get the digital signals without a digital antenna, I would recommend purchasing an antenna if you do not have cable.  The signals will be stronger and you will pick up more channels.  There are plenty of bells and whistles. My only regret is not waiting a few more months as the prices are much lower now.  The only reason I didn't rate a 5 is becuase it's not a SONY. Other than that, it's perfection!!!

Reviews.Title: Poor quality and warranty service
Reviews.Author: James M. Letsky
Reviews.Content: After owning the TV for about 2 months, it developed a high-pitched whine from the back of the set (not the speakers). Samsung told me that it was a faulty power supply unit.  Since it is more than 30 days old, Amazon wont do an exchange, and my only option through Samsung is to pack and ship the TV (at my own expense) to their repair facility in New Jersey (I live in Washington DC). So in order to make my (now 5 month old) TV work, I have to pay about $120 to ship it out for repairs that will take from 5 to 8 weeks.  Strongly recommend that you look for a different brand with better quality control and more reasonable warranty service.

Reviews.Title: Overall okay but reviews on volume are dead on!
Reviews.Author: B. Linnemeier
Reviews.Content: Good value and nice looking; however, I need to put it all the way to 100 -the highest setting, to hear a program from about fifteen feet away (in my adjoining master bath).  This is for my bedroom and really I use it only for morning news / talk shows while I get ready.  The picture is NOT crisp when it is on for people's faces in fact it is really very distorted / blurry - I was really surprised given technology today that I would get such a bad picture.

Reviews.Title: Great HD/Digital TV for the Kitchen!
Reviews.Author: Mike/MASS
Reviews.Content: We have a decent sized rectangular shaped kitchen and wanted a stylish, high-performance, brand-name LCD TV.  I didn't want a cable box cluttering up the room, and decided up front that our new kitchen TV would be wall mounted and have it's own digital tuner.  The other criteria was that I didn't want a black housing, so that narrowed down our choices to some silver models and this piano-finish white Samsung.  Our cabinets are all medium dark oak and all the moldings at the eating end of the kitchen are white with a sort of cream color on the walls.  We felt the black model would jump off the wall a bit too much.I read the reviews and have to admit I was somewhat concerned as several reviewers complained about the audio quality of this set. Samsung makes some beautiful TVs and while the only comparable model I could find at my local Best Buy was the black version of this set... I took a chance and ordered (through Amazon).  Well, I got the set and a Sanus VisionMount VM3 and I did the install myself.  What I did was run a 50' HDMI cable from my Family Room home theater setup along with a 75 Ohm digital cable at eye height along with a 110v outlet.  So all cables and outlets are hidden behind the TV as it's mounted diagonally in the corner.The picture quality with both the cable and HDMI sources is outstanding.  The audio issue turned out to be a non-issue.  There were some complaints about lack of volume?  Maybe Samsung fixed it because we have no complaints and I have no idea how loud it can go... but we rarely set the volume over 18-20 and I know it goes up into the 30's.  Click on the menu and select Audio, then look at all the options for fixed settings... (speech, music, movies, etc.) and if you're finicky, there's a graphic equalizer to tweak to your hearts content for a custom sound definition.HD picture quality is remarkable, and even the analog cable and digital cable channels are excellent.  My source is Comcast cable.  We've received nothing but compliments this past weekend as we hosted a sunday football party and the women loved the idea of a very stylish white TV suspended from the wall that can swivel in almost any direction.  The guys were more concerned with the picture quality of the games and I have to say that we have no artifacting or crystalizing at all.  Samsung hit a home run with this one.I'll also say that Amazon's price beat any local retailer by a mile (almost $100.00 less) and the only available white unit I found was at Best Buy but it was the 20" version of this set and more expensive than the 22'!

Reviews.Title: Nice TV but weak speakers
Reviews.Author: joeThePlumber
Reviews.Content: Very nice image, no problem at all.  The response to remote control is very fast.  The base needs to be firmly attached with fasteners or else it would come off when the TV is lifted.  I have it wall-mounted with a $60 Peerless articulating mount.  The VESA mounting spec made sure that the Peerless mount would have its holes aligned perfectly with the mounting holes on the TV.I see no weakness except the tiny speakers.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Picture - Problems with Verizon FIOS
Reviews.Author: R. Tishkevich
Reviews.Content: I love my 22 inch Samsung. I was going to buy a 26 inch set, however, the sofa's only 5 or 6 feet from the TV, so 22 inches is more than adequate. The picture is outstanding, however, I have one problem that cannot be solved because it's with Verizon, not Samsung.We have Verizon FIOS and our Samsung TV is connected to a Verizon HD box via an HDMI cable. It worked well for a few hours, but then we lost the signal to the HDMI connector. This happened on and off again for two days, so Verizon sent out a service technician. While he was at the house, he commented about the outstanding quality of the picture on the Samsung. He installed a new HDMI cable and he also attached Component Cables as a backup, just in case with had more problems with the HDMI signal.I'm glad he installed the Component Cables because we lost the HDMI signal one day after he left. Investigation with Samsung revealed there is an HDMI incompatibility with Verizon Set Top Boxes. There's nothing wrong with the Samsung HDMI connector, it's just that the Verizon Set Top Boxes are slightly behind the time and currently do not support the advanced Samsung HDMI connector. Hopefully a Verizon Firmware upgrade will eventually solve this problem.Until that time, we've been using the Component Cables to connect with the Verizon Set Top box and the picture is still outstanding! If you don't need a gigantic television, I highly recommend this 22 inch LCD HD TV.As for the audio, it's fine and on par with other LCD TV's. If you're an audio buff and need top of the line audio, connect the TV to an inexpensive Samsung [or any other brand] Home Theater system. That's what we did. I connected our 22 inch Samsung to an Onkyo Stereo Receiver, along with two bookshelf speakers and the sound is terrific.We're pleased with the 22 inch screen because we sit so close to the television. You'll have to be the judge on screen size because it's obviously a personal preference. We also like the fact that it doesn't take up very much room.As for the picture, everyone who sees it loves the quality of the video.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN22A450
Reviews.Author: J. Martin
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for two weeks.  The picture using the AV connections is good.  The TV also looks good. The onlycomplaint is the sound.  The speakers sound like those on a small portable radio.  Fortunately for me I have been able to use a spare Yamaha speaker connected to my receiver for sound.  Despite the speaker problem, I got a good deal by buying a refurbished set saving $100+.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN22A450
Reviews.Author: J. Martin
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for two weeks.  The picture using the AV connections is good.  The TV also looks good. The onlycomplaint is the sound.  The speakers sound like those on a small portable radio.  Fortunately for me I have been able to use a spare Yamaha speaker connected to my receiver for sound.  Despite the speaker problem, I got a good deal by buying a refurbished set saving $100+.

Reviews.Title: Sweet!
Reviews.Author: Rhodan
Reviews.Content: As a semi-pro digital photographer I'm really critical about color accuracy.  If you spend the time tweaking the various color settings you can get excellent results from a high-quality source.  The up-scaling from standard video is a bonus, much better than any tube (CRT) TV, very smooth and detailed with no obvious artifacts.  Check out "The Fellowship of the Ring" from the LotR trilogy--it looks almost like 3-D!!!  I don't have HD but I expect the HD quality would be even higher.As many have noted, the sound is adequate at best, but the built-in equalizer helps a lot.  The Logitech S220 2.1 system would probably be a good sound upgrade for this TV.The auto-matching of aspect ratio from various sources has worked perfectly.  Again, a huge improvement over a standard 4:3 tube TV.  My previous set was an outstanding 20" Toshiba flat-screen tube model (i.e., not LCD), but this Samsung LCD beats it in every respect.  I'd never go back to a tube TV, and I think this Samsung is a great buy for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great combo TV and computer monitor
Reviews.Author: Robert Stein "RaslDasl"
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift to replace both a CRT TV and CRT computer monitor. It works great as both. The resolution is only 768 (720p for TV) but it supports higher output from your PC if you need it. The setup could not have been easier, just connected the cables, turned it on and it found all the TV channels. We are using it with basic cable and the picture looks great. The only disappointment was that this beautiful white TV (the 451 model) came with a black power cord. Fortunately it's a standard PC/monitor power cable and we were able to use the old beige cord from the CRT we were replacing to make it blend in better. Samsung should inlude a white power cord with the white model of this TV.

Reviews.Title: A little disappointing
Reviews.Author: Lou Flet "Electech"
Reviews.Content: This is our third LCD TV.  When we compare this smaller 22 inch to our Sony 32 inch (one year old) and our Samsung 46 inch (eight Months old) we are dissapointed in a couple things.  First the picture quality varies a lot with the viewing angle.  This means that you have to be right in front of the screen to get an acceptable picture.  The picture seems to have a film over it, even streight on  It may be a problem with all the small screen sizes.  Second, the sound quality is far less than what I would expect from a product by this manufacturer.  There is no excuse for this.

Reviews.Title: OK TV with horrible sound
Reviews.Author: Moreless32
Reviews.Content: I bought this model for viewing in my kitchen.  Not a good choice for that purpose.  The sound is tiny and inconsistant.  It was very hard to hear with common noises that come from a kitchen(running water, cooking, dish washer, kids...)  The picture quality is also very poor. It is very dark and got even worse from side angles.  It also is not a true 16:9 size.  There are black bars across the top and the bottom of the screen in true 16:9 format.  I didn't think this would bother me that much but it did get very annoying.  I ended up sending this back and bought a Sony 26 inch KDL26M4000.  It was more money and a little bigger than what I wanted for my kitchen, but the comparison is night and day.  The sound may not be a problem for someone that can hook up to a sound system, but that is not an option for a kitchen.

Reviews.Title: It's Okay
Reviews.Author: My2cents
Reviews.Content: This TV is okay.  The design is nice.  The picture is good but the blacks can be to dark and over bearing.  No amount of adjusting helped.  For the price you can get a better TV.  I'm okay with it, but wish I had bought a 26-inch instead.  One thing that does bother me a little is the top of the screen all the way across has a slight white glow that you can notice on certain pictures on the screen esp if they are darker or not full screen scenes.

Reviews.Title: Save your $$!!!
Reviews.Author: John J. Arvai
Reviews.Content: I am extremely disappointed with this TV.  Small quality sound aside (and expected) its the viewing angles that I find extremely poor especially for a Samsung product.  I get a different picture quality from every anlge and the only accetable one is when I'm looking dead on the screen front/center.I'm even more disspointed I didn't order from Amazon as NewEgg has a non-refundable policy on this product that I did not pay attention to when I ordered.If anyone is interested in a great deal on this TV that I've used for less than a day email me at arvai2@hotmail.com.If I can't resell it its going to be a really expensive computer monitor.

Reviews.Title: A wonderful surprise!
Reviews.Author: joemama127
Reviews.Content: I must admit that I'm a plasma fanboy who in the past thumbed my nose at lcd tv's. Recently I had a direct lightning strike on my home that fried four tv's, a microwave and garage door opener. I replaced our media room tv with a newer updated 50" Panasonic plasma (TH-50PZ85U) which is fantastic...and for the downstairs livingroom and master bedroom I chose 32" LG Plasmas (very good but no match for the Panny) and then came the dilemma for the kids room and guest bedroom...can't justify large sets or too expensive so I decided to bite the bullet and go with 20"-26" lcd's.After deciding on this Samsung based on generally favorable reviews I ordered two (shipped lightning fast by Amazon/UPS) and imagine my surprise when I found that the picture quality/features were actually above and beyond what I was expecting! These sets are very thin and light..minimalist bezel and stand with attractive black gloss. The colors out of the box were a little off but with just a few minutes of tweaking I had the sets looking very good...and not just "good for an lcd".The only cons with this set are pretty minor...the remote feels kind of cheap and is not backlit..but is laid-out well and has buttons for every function. Also another con is the speaker quality...it isn't what I would call bad by any means but a little below average even compared to other lower cost flat screen tv's.Overall I am very satisfied with not only the tv's but also the great price/fast shipping from Amazon. I haven't converted to an lcd man yet, but I no longer fear them. Kudos Samsung!

Reviews.Title: Disappointment
Reviews.Author: E. C. McFarland
Reviews.Content: I bought this about 6 months ago and loved it till it just stopped working.  It turns it self off and on till it eventually craps out.  The only way to turn it off is to unplug it.  Could barley understand the customer service rep due to lots of background noise on her end so I finally hung up and went online.  I have to pay to ship it to NJ, who knows when I will see it again.

Reviews.Title: Very good value HDTV
Reviews.Author: Red Wedge
Reviews.Content: This is my first HDTV, and, for the money, I'm very satisfied. I needed a TV to go with a PlayStation 3, and this Samsung's HDMI input, 720p (and 1080i) image are perfect for those needs.There are a lot of reviews about this TV, so I'll just summarize the basic points.- It's not true 16:9. You can change the picture size easily from the remote, and 16:9 channels do create a thin letterboxing effect. However, the 'wide' setting eradicates these with no discernible side effects. Plus, for HDMI input, there is a 'Just Scan' option which seems to simply display every transmitted pixel - perfect for the PS3.- Yes, the sound is not perfect. Out of the box it is pretty flat. You can easily create a custom EQ which helps a lot. The speakers are small - it's a small TV - but perfectly adequate once the EQ is adjusted to suit your requirements. The volume level is perfectly fine - in my house it is set around 15-30 out of 100. So - plenty of room for much louder volume.- Picture quality is great. There is the problem of viewing angle. The best picture is achieved when viewing fairly directly. I sit a new feet below it, and the image is a little darker. From the left and right, this is also a problem. However - the TV can be tilted backwards on the stand. The stand can also be wall mounted, and the TV tilted forwards. So there is quite a lot of flexibility. This kind of problem is normal in cheaper TVs, but it is not that significant with this TV. I have certainly seen far, far worse.- I don't have any problem with the remote button layout. It's fine.- I miss an electronic program guide in the digital transceiver. It's an unfortunate omission, but I can live without it.- Image quality is excellent.- The PS3 looks great on it, and beside it. They are a match made in heaven - shiny, black, plastic heaven.All in all, I am very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Good TV ... with 2 problems
Reviews.Author: P. Perry
Reviews.Content: The Samsung 22 in is fine for our bedroom, and meets our needs.  However, there are 2 things that have disappointed:  the sound is "tinny"  We have scrolled through the various sound settings, and some are better than others, but none of them are the audio quality that other TV's in our house have ...The other issue is that when you are using a menu to change various settings (sleep-timer), sound, color, etc..) the font is so small that one needs to walk up to the TV to see what it says  (not fun when you are already in bed)  I've looked everywhere to find a way to enlarge the print menu size, but to no avail.  If anyone knows of one, please let me know!Color is good, picture is good, etc.

Reviews.Title: A sonically challenged TV
Reviews.Author: Old doc
Reviews.Content: Many reviews of this TV note the dreadfully inadequate speakers, and it is painfully true. I've heard better quality sound through a tin can on a string. So be prepared to buy a set of decent speakers if you choose this TV.  Also expect to spend an excessive amount of time adjusting the picture for accurate color and brightness.

Reviews.Title: Great Value for a small HD TV
Reviews.Author: W. Lorensen
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a TV for our new three season room. We looked for a white TV with high quality HD. A year ago, we bought a smaller white Samsung for our Kitchen / Dining room and love it. We have cable TV and these sets pick up the local channels in HD without a cable conversion box. This is a great set for our room.

Reviews.Title: Perfect- just not 16:9.
Reviews.Author: I. Holland
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV as our primary TV for in the living room of our new apartment. We wanted something discreet- that would not take over the room as most TVs do so we figured a white LCD TV would be best. This Samsung has a great picture when on and when off looks very elegant. We placed it in the corner of the room on a side table and when off it merely compliments our decor. Primarily we watch it from about 8', but its also easily viewable from a sharp angle 12' away in the kitchen. We didnt mount the TV but the holes are there for mounting purposes and the directions include a section on how to best mount the TV. The A/V inputs are on the back of the TV, which would limit how close to the wall its mountable. We have had the TV now for almost a month and have nothing but positive comments about it.The only negative is that it is not true 16:9.  When viewing programs/movies in 16:9 format (which is the majority of movies now) the viewing size of this TV is technically about 20" not 22" which leaves black bars on the top and bottom of the screen 2-3" thick.  For me, this did not affect my purchase because there are simply not that many TVs this size that are 16:9.I read most of the reviews on Amazon, especially all the bad reviews, and I have to say I have had none of the problems that were in the bad reviews. My TV didnt come with a sticker on the LCD display like some customers. HD channels (through Comcast) look excellent. Even DVDs viewed on our cheap, old DVD player look great. As far as the sound, my only guess is some customers must have received a flawed product. The sound is great, I have only turned it up half-way and it is plenty loud. However, the sound may be a little on the tinny side; but I hardly see how you could expect more from small, built-in speakers. I am a bit of an audio perfectionist myself and ever since I planned on buying a new HDTV I also planned on buying a new sound system.  (Correct me if I'm wrong, buy I thought it was well known fact that if you want an amazing picture and amazing sound then you will buy a tv AND a sound system- no matter the price of the TV.) Even so, after having the TV for a month I am content with the built-in speakers. If I do happen to purchase a sound system for this TV it will only be if I need a little extra retail therapy after Christmas.

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly Surprised!
Reviews.Author: Deborah L. Ford "Feisty58"
Reviews.Content: I searched for months for a 26 inch HDTV that I thought would be compatible for my bedroom use.  I was going to purchase the Sony 26" for $899.00, but when I saw this Samsung 22" for less than $500.00, I held my breath and ordered it.  The reviews were very good as well.  So I must tell you that I am "pleasantly surprised" with my purchase.  The picture is awesome and the sound is not as bad as some have stated. I set it up in no time and it looks great (as pictured) in my bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Good TV bad sound - enough problem!
Reviews.Author: Mojo
Reviews.Content: We have to send it back. The audio issue is intermittent, and typically only when seeing high def source video - I believe it is with both 780p/i as well as 1080i.  The problem corrupts the audio intelligibility, and sounds like a distorted signal that sweeps back and forth with a peculiar modulation effect, similar to a flanger but with a higher distortion that makes the sounds mostly un-intelligible.  This problem usually stops after some time, but mostly is undiscriminate - and we've stopped it by switching channels back and forth - only to find it happen again, at some undetermined periodocity.

Reviews.Title: 16:10 display
Reviews.Author: jwwoods
Reviews.Content: It seems to work well with its decent tuner in my suburban location and using an indoor antenna.  But any significant wind causes dropout of the digital signal.  I am hoping that the turn-off of the analog broadcast signals in June will permit an increase in the digital signal level transmitted.There are two problems I have noticed with this TV.  First, it is 16:10 not 16:9.  Thus an HD signal must be stretched by about 11% vertically to fill the screen.  Otherwise there is a 5.5% black bar at top and bottom for the correct 16:9 display.  It is slightly a problem for me.  Second, while this TV has several inputs: HDMI, component, S-video, and composite, there is only one of each and the S-video and composite share a common audio input.  This means that you cannot hook up a composite VCR and a S-video DVD player simultaneously.  One would have to buy a switch. This is a potential problem for me.Otherwise the picture is good, although looking a bit poorly interpolated at times, but solid with a good HD signal AND choosing the 16:9 display mode.  Finally, the sound has been commented on in these amazon reviews.  I find it very adequate for use in a small room such as a typical bedroom or office.  No problem there.

Reviews.Title: Samsung, a So-So
Reviews.Author: Philip A. Feinberg "Philip Feinberg"
Reviews.Content: For background info purposes, let me first say that my Samsung is rooftop antenna-connected via an RF modulator, and it is not connected to any other units (VCR, DVD player, ...). This is the same setup I maintained with the 18 year old TV the Samsung replaced, and I simply ended up reusing the RF modulator as a preference option. This decision, however, turned out to be one supported by a Samsung tech support person, who said that the modulator would enhance the picture quality all the more.Whether or not picture quality is enhanced by the modulator connection, I cannot say, as I haven't tried my setup without it. All I can say is that the picture quality is excellent, and that is without having had to do any adjustment tweaking (sharpness, contrast, brightness, ....). Thus, I would rate picture quality as my Samsung's best, most satisfying attribute.I am also pleased with the user-friendly remote. The numerals are generously large, and are color-contrasted with the remote's black background, which adds to visibility ease. Other icon and identifier buttons are likewise easy to ID and access. Moreover, buttons are nicely clustered, enabling easy location/activation.Samsung also gets kudos for the user-friendly owner's guide, which even I --- a tech-challenged hater of instruction manuals --- was able to navigate for set-up and adjustments, thanks to the thorough and easy to follow, step-by-step instructions and helpful illustrations. I surprised myself by completing the set-up, including programming the remote, with little angst and no tantrums!With regard to dissatisfaction, I would rate Samsung's overall sound quality as its primarily negative feature. It is woefully sub-standard and most disappointing. Without exaggeration, the sound quality emitted by this Samsung model is actually inferior to that of my old TVs, low-end computer, and even my inexpensive radios. The sound is tinny and"echoey". And unfortunately,neither the manual-based sound adjustment options nor Samsung tech support contacts were able to completely overcome the sound deficiencies. I'm thinking that the type and location of the TV's speakers --- on the bottom of the unit --- may be part of the problem. However, I was able, by strictly trial and error, to achieve some sound improvement by playing around with the bandwidth adjustments (per the Sound Customizing section of the manual). I have since found that the sound quality, whether due to my happenstance adjustments or not, is just a bit improved, but tends to vary with channel (including digital), as well as with voice vs. music output. Actually, at times, the music-based sound comes through well. I don't understand the sound variability enigma here, which is somewhat annoying, but I have determined that I can live with the sound in its current state, though reluctantly so.The one other negative feature is the ridiculously small, channel ID caption square (blue background/white numerals) which appears at the top left on the screen when making a channel change. Now, my distance vision is quite good, and I have watched TV from the same distance for 32 years, never having a problem seeing any emergent captions, etc. on any TV. But with this Samsung, especially when channel surfing, I literally have to get up from the couch and move a bit closer to the TV to see the caption figures. And with the multitude of adjustments that one canmake for so many of the Samsung features, you'd think that the caption could be enlarged. But alas, a Samsung contact revealed no such option.Would I have purchased this Samsung, based on knowing what I know now relative to the above? I think I'd probably opt to check out other Samsung models or other brands altogether beforehand, which is my recommendation to other potential buyers.

Reviews.Title: irratating noise, greate picture
Reviews.Author: Flight_173 "Flow on"
Reviews.Content: bought this TV because of the price/pro's ration, and the good reviews.PROS1. the TV is the perfect size, fits nicely in my bedroom, and produces a suitable sound volume.2. the picture is crisp and clear3. sleek design and remote controller are both minor pros4. despite spec that say it only supports 720 pixels, when attached to my ps3 via hdmi3 cords it says I'm receiving 1080pi.CONS1. produced a faint but notable buzzing noise after 2 weeks2. shipped it to costumer repairs and after 3 phone calls and 2 1/2 months later it came back with the same noise.I decided to keep the TV, I turn off the incoming power to it before i sleep.

Reviews.Title: samsung tv
Reviews.Author: older and wiser
Reviews.Content: good picture.sound not the best.when TV on standby you can hear a high pitch hum.

Reviews.Title: Good little TV
Reviews.Author: LBG
Reviews.Content: I bought this for use in our bedroom, and knew from the start that we wouldn't be adding an external sound system. But one of the features that seems consistently poor on these smaller LCD sets is sound quality, so I was a bit unsure of what to expect. Turns out, the built-in speakers on this Samsung are impressive: not tinny at all, and relatively rich (and not buzzy) when we increase volume to higher levels.Overall, set-up was easy, picture quality is quite good (no dead pixels, with a sharp picture on the HD channels), and the styling is clean and sleek. The menu system is relatively straightforward -- only reason I'm giving this four stars rather than five (and honestly would have put it at 4.5 if it were an option) is the electronic series of beeps it makes upon powering on and off. Can't find a way to disable it, and when you're trying to turn a television off without waking up another person, that's a (small) drawback.

Reviews.Title: great picture
Reviews.Author: albert tamayo
Reviews.Content: The picture on this set is great.  Sony XBR and KDl are supposed to have even greater viewing angles than this television, but the Samsung is right up there in that category.  The picture is great.  The sound is not impressive although better than what I expected from a set of 2 watt speakers.  You can always add audio to this television.  I am very pleased with this product.

Reviews.Title: Good tv for the price
Reviews.Author: Chudwad1
Reviews.Content: The television was shipped securely and arrived quickly as promised.  My thirteen year old daughter and I were able to set up the tv fairly easily and quickly.  However, the HD picture quality is not as good as we expected, apparently because we are using the old yellow, white, and red cable connectors instead of the newer HD cable.  I'm hoping the picture quality will improve once we purchase and install this new cable.  It's too bad this information wasn't listed on the box or in the ad (like companies do if their product needs batteries to work). I would have made sure I had the better cable so that when this was set up on Christmas morning it would have had a better picture.

Reviews.Title: samsung..unsung
Reviews.Author: THE FRUIT DOCTOR "happy in lake worth"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for use in the bedroom because of the compact size. The t.v. was easy to set up and had a nice appearence. The problems are that the sound is terrible and the picture quality is sub standard. I do not recommend this set, spend a little more and get a better sound and picture quality unit. i returned this item.

Reviews.Title: Great bedroom TV
Reviews.Author: J. Kennedy
Reviews.Content: I Bought the Samsung LN19A450 last year for the den and loved it, bought the LN22A450 for the master bedroom because I was so pleased with the 19 inch.  The picture is great, sound is ok, very easy setup, remote is not layed out for easy one hand use (I use the Direct TV remote and this is not a problem for me) and the set has enough inputs so I can use it for my dish, rabbit ears and computer all at the same time.

Reviews.Title: View for a gamer
Reviews.Author: D. Jewel
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV because my PS3 was lonely without an actual HDTV.  I did a lot of shopping around, I even came close to purchasing a Westinghouse TV but [...] won't take my card--and I'm glad they didn't.  I wasn't too excited about paying the price, but I knew I was getting a quality product from Samsung.  It has one HDMI port, RGB port, and the standard AV port, along with audio out and some other things that are become the standard.  I've hooked my PS3 up to it via an HDMI cable and I have SO impressed with what I see on my screen.  I watched a BlueRay movie on it and WOW is there some detail I would have never seen in theaters!  And the sound isn't half bad either.  It's like a step down from high quality surround sound.  When I first bought the TV, I didn't get the HDMI right away, I played games on the Standard AV--which was something I didn't want to last forever.  Do yourself a favor--avoid using the AV, it makes things blurred/pixelated.  Reading text on the screen was not an easy thing to do.  HDMI is the way to go.  The controller is easy to use and getting around the menu is fairly easy.  I highly recommend this product.  Wouldn't you want to be the envy of your roommates?

Reviews.Title: samsung 22-inch lcdtv
Reviews.Author: Stanukos "fussy buyer"
Reviews.Content: Had problem setting up an adequate picture. Got tired of trying and finally decided to return the item. Return was accepted without prejudice. No restocking charge, but did have to pay return shipping costs.

Reviews.Title: USED but just as good as new
Reviews.Author: B. Nguyen "No love for Retail prices."
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV used with "minor damage on housing" for $248.  It was a HELLUVA deal.  The minor damage on housing was a small tiny cosmetic scratch on the stand.  Who cares about the stand.  The TV came sooner than expected and I didnt have to pay for sales tax or shipping.  The TV itself works very well, has good picture, and sounds is great.  I dont know what people are complaining about regarding the sound.  Samsung's make the best TV.  I have had a 51 inch SAmsung DLP for 5years it looks and works great.  IM a fan of brand consistency.  I work in finance, so i have this TV in my work office and keep it on CNBC all day. No HDMI just air feed.  it works perfectly for a office tv.very satisfied with the TV and AMAZON

Reviews.Title: Ideal size TV for kitchen/breakfast room
Reviews.Author: paul larson "happy customer"
Reviews.Content: I have a 46" Samsung in my living room and have been very satisfied with this brand.Samsung's 22" model is the right choice for my breakfast room. Both sound and picture quality are very good. I'd recommend this model without reservations

Reviews.Title: Great Deal
Reviews.Author: Tyemco "Tyler"
Reviews.Content: So i have been looking around for a lcd tv for a long time.  Researching internet prices vs. store prices.  Since i couldnt view the quality of this tv personally i went to my local bestbuy to see if they had the same model.  They did and the picture quality was amazing.  This tv was a great deal at $350.  Bestbuy had the same tv for $400.  I was a little skeptical about buying this tv because of the mixed reviews, however i am so glad i did.  The picture quality is amazing.  Very good for a 22'.  A lot of people complained about the sound.  Well yea this tv is not built for a huge living room (being 22'), but for a small or even big bedroom, it is just perfect.  I did not want to pay $20 for shipping so i decided to go with the free super savings shipping with an estimated shipping between 7 and 9 days.  I ordered this tv from amazon on friday and received it that coming tuesday.  4 days, 2 being a weekend, that was very impressive.  Some people even complained about the picture quality.  They probably didnt customize it.  The factory setting is not always perfect.  So after tweaking a few settings, the picture was beautiful.  I highly recommend this product.  Plus you have samsungs high reputation behind it.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 22" HDTV
Reviews.Author: B. Soska "onegriff"
Reviews.Content: I love this Tv. The picture is wonderful and that extra 3" from a 19 means the world of difference. It's a little slow when you first put it on, but the picture quality overrides this feature.  Shipping was very fast and came in great condition.  It also was the lowest price I could find even on sale. I would not be afraid to  order any electronic item on line.  VERY SATISFIED!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Solid Product, But Backlight Needs Redesign
Reviews.Author: Roland A. Martin II "Rollie"
Reviews.Content: Paid $339 on sale, which was a great value. Using this in my kitchen and replaced a 1st generation 15" Zenith HD-ready set. Mounted easily to my existing VESA wall bracket without having to purchase any additional hardware. Picture is good enough for the kitchen, but the backlight/screen design leaves a dull light around the perimeter (particularly at top) that would drive me nuts in a bedroom, etc. - but again, just fine for the kitchen. I have a 32" 720p Bravia in the bedroom and no backlight issues with that set. Plenty of features and speakers are just fine for where I'm using it. Some complain about the speakers, but if you're using this (as with any small set) as your primary TV in the living room, bedroom, etc., you should have a separate sound system for it. Same goes for the comments regarding the size of the screen menus - I've got 4 HD sets in my home and the menu system and size on this set is just fine. Other comments note that this is not 16:9, which is incorrect. Many films made today are not 16:9 - same goes for broadcast TV - which means you'll end up with bars on the tops or sides when viewing in wide mode. You can get rid of them by switching to one of two zoom modes.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Labora
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this TV a lot of good reviews so I will just hit some basic points the other ones brought up.*Sound is fine for me and my gaming needs I can barely turn the TV up halfway without it blasting me out. Sure it may not be theater quality but it is better then past TVs I've owned.*Line of sight. As other people have brought up if you are not facing the TV directly it will seem dim. I have mine set above my desk and it is dim unless I have it pointed downward a bit. I will probably end up getting a diffrent mount for it. The TV does not come with a mount that allows it to tilt up/down so keep this in mind!*Picture quality is very good on my xbox 360, very happy with it!*Computer monitor. I have this hooked up to my computer and watch full screen movies on it from time to time. My computer (running XP) picked up the correct drivers for it right away and It seems to display great.

Reviews.Title: Good picture and sound for the economical price
Reviews.Author: Thrifty Guy "Thrifty Guy"
Reviews.Content: Overall, I am content with this purchase. The only warning is that channel numbers appear very small and for too short of a time. Every time one changes the channel up or down (and one does not know where one is starting from), it is not easy to see the read out /counter for each channel since they are too small and they stay up for a fraction of a second. This can be frustrating. Still, it delivers great picture and sound in a compact and economical package.

Reviews.Title: good for the money
Reviews.Author: Babs
Reviews.Content: The Samsung TV was just what I wanted and expected. Everything works fine. It's in the kitchen so I'm not too concerned about the quality of the audio or video. It's just a TV. I bought a Samsung because of it's good reputation. I wanted something that wouldn't break down.

Reviews.Title: perfect size and perfect price.
Reviews.Author: Ned Sokoloff
Reviews.Content: white for the kitchen.  fit perfectly in the nook incredible picture. delivered in less than 48 hours.  unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: good tv, but disappointed in product
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "karwyn, the growing"
Reviews.Content: Pros: The Tv was delivered ahead of schedule and in perfect condition.  Great picture standing right in front of it, but not as crisp as 1080. Similar set-up to our 52 inch 650 LCD Black Samsung TV (also bought from Amazon), so was easy to navigate.. Sets up digital for air very well. We do not have cable. We live in the city. We use an inexpensive HD antenna from WalMart that works very well and can be adjusted when needed. Cosmetically it is a beautiful little tv and the white is much easier to keep clean than our black touch of red-does not seem to be as much of a dust magnet as the black.  It is white for our bedroom, and there was not much to choose from in the white category.Cons:  The picture becomes dark or discolored when viewing from the sides or below straight on viewing. The sound is low at times and varies on different channels. The font when setting or trying to  change set-up on the tv is very small so can only be seen very close up. The sound cuts out and the picture goes out briefly if a person comes too close to the tv accompanied by an annoying noise (adjusting the antenna has helped, but not always). Maybe a better antenna would do the trick in this area.It is OK for our TV viewing in the bedroom, but we are looking for a different TV for the kitchen in the same size.  We wanted Samsung since our 5 star 52 inch Samsung is absolutely wonderful. We originally were going to buy two of these (22 inch white) and I still might since the ratings and price for the 650 22 inch Samsung in black is about the same as this one. 22 inch Tvs just are not as great as the 32 inch and above Tvs are.  All in all a good enough tv which we will not send back, but disappointed nonetheless. Others that we looked at Best Buy in the 22 inch size were very similar and not as good. However,the Samsung 650 LCD in the 22 inch size has 3 HDMI inputs at Best Buy whereas the one offered at Amazon has only 1. Amazon's much cheaper, though and that is probably why.

Reviews.Title: Good clear picture
Reviews.Author: Southern Yankee
Reviews.Content: We looked at a lot of televisions in this size, but this one had the best picture by far.  Fast action still is a bit of a problem, but we didn't see any televisions in this size that didn't blur of pixelate in action scenes.  The speakers are really not very good, but in our case we have a sound system attached to it for use when sound is important, so it does not really matter.  Overall, it is a very good television in this size.

Reviews.Title: nice tv!
Reviews.Author: tadaka8
Reviews.Content: great tv! connects to laptop with no problem and just the right size for my room.

Reviews.Title: As warned
Reviews.Author: SH
Reviews.Content: We have been using our new Samsung for 3 weeks now. It is just as I have read in previous reviews a great lcd TV with poor (tinny) sound. I have attached external JBL speakers and all is good.

Reviews.Title: Great TV - Poor Sound
Reviews.Author: Rieta Review
Reviews.Content: We love the picture, and the size is perfect for our breakfast room.  The major problem is the "hidden speakers" that Samsung touts.  Major adjustments to the sound menu helped but the sound acts like it's coming from a can.  Probably will attach a couple of external speakers to see if they will help.  Our intercom system sounds better with only one speaker.

Reviews.Title: seac
Reviews.Author: seacrae
Reviews.Content: This television is a great deal for the price.  22inch is perfect for a bedroom and picture quality is excellent.  I have two different brands of flat screen TV, and I prefer the samsung over the other one. I would definitely by another samsung TV.

Reviews.Title: Nice HD Picture, Terrible Speakers
Reviews.Author: Janyth
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 95-year-old parents for Christmas.  Simplicity is essential in anything they use (they had rabbit ears until four months ago -- cable still throws them a curve and they won't give up their VCR).  This little TV was easy for me to hook up in their breakfast room... and 22" was a perfect size.  The remote is wonderful for them -- not too many buttons and all are a decent size & well marked.  However, the volume does not go high enough for them (they are very deaf) and the tinny speakers produce a nasty sound when even 60% volume is used.  HORRIBLE SPEAKERS.  I wish I had bought something else -- I am going to have to buy my parents external speakers now.

Reviews.Title: 22" LCD
Reviews.Author: Jim "Wojo"
Reviews.Content: Second Samsung LCD purchase.  I am impressed with the Samsung LCD's.  The 22" is for the bedroom and is as expected.  Don't buy it looking for superb stereo sound, it's a 22" LCD after all and you aren't going to watch it in a move theatre atmosphere.  It does its job well.  I'll stick with Samsung (and I'll buy them thru Amazon as long as they sell them....great service)

Reviews.Title: SAMSUNG LN22A450 LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Hankpe
Reviews.Content: I unpacked the HDTV and with the minimum of effort had it connected to my 'Rabbit-ears' antenna and my DVD recorder player in a minimum of time.  It worked flawlessly.  I have set up the audio for surround sound, and scanned for all available channels.  I purchased a HDTV indoor antenna, but have not installed it yet. This was a good buy and I am impressed with the picture and sound.  I would recommend it to anyone that has a small room for the TV.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 22" 720 HDTV
Reviews.Author: D. E. Bryan "bugeater"
Reviews.Content: Out of the box this TV set up fine, somewhat noisy on some channels, but it could be the cable service. The remote is poor and requires multiple pushes to activate most things.

Reviews.Title: Great T.V.
Reviews.Author: Matthew Mitchell
Reviews.Content: This is really just a great television. The sound is a bit on the tinny side (or lack of fullness), but overall the picture is fantastic and has lots of inputs and outputs on the back... if you like playing around with that stuff.

Reviews.Title: Great Little T.V.
Reviews.Author: J. G. "J.G."
Reviews.Content: We gave this T.V. to our mother who is in a 1 bedroom condo. It fit perfectly in her little living room. The picture is great. The only drawback is the sound. Why they put the speakers in the back, I don't know. My son said we could get a set of small speakers if necessary. We haven't tried that yet. Otherwise, I highly recommend this T.V.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV!
Reviews.Author: TV fanatic "AT"
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this TV for my boyfriend's bedroom.  The size is perfect and the picture is crystal clear.  I haven't had any problems with the sound and am 100% impressed with this set.  If you will be purchasing this (or any other TV set) within the next week and are a Comcast member, Circuit City is giving $100 off all TVs!  With this deal, I purchased this exact Samsung TV set (out of box, but with no visible or technical problems) for $280!!  I highly recommend this TV and am considering purchasing more for my house.

Reviews.Title: Sharp picture...not the sound
Reviews.Author: J. Cloud
Reviews.Content: This TV has a very nice sharp picture.  The sound, however, is disappointing.  It sounds like a small transistor radio, but everything is audible.  I also did not realize that the screen would be quite that small.  Since tv screens have gone longer, the width from top to bottom has dropped.... not like the older square tubes... so I got a "smaller" picture than I thought.  However, any wider and it would not have fit into my old entertainment center.  It is lightweight and easy to use.  It is still a good tv with Samsung quality.

Reviews.Title: Poor Sound Quality
Reviews.Author: Terry "Terry"
Reviews.Content: Good:  Shipping, Sleek DesignFair:  Picture qualityPoor:  SoundThe sound quality was so poor that it over ruled anything good about this product.

Reviews.Title: 22 inch Samsung LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Louie from Waterloo  Iowa
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this purchase. Takes a little time to get the TV settings the way I like them. Very nice picture once that's done. Great price from Amazon on this one. Better than anyone else and the shipping was free with Amazon Prime.

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: Anne Lamb
Reviews.Content: I bought the 22" because I loved the white case and it was recommended to me by a salesman I trusted.  I hate it and am trying to sell the thing for $100.00 less than I paid just 3 months ago. I am unable to read the channel numbers because they are so tiny and do not stay on the screen long enough for my eyes to focus on them. I was told by the "help line" and the store salesman that the font size can not be changed. Also,the picture quality is not as good as I received from my 10 year old TV.

Reviews.Title: Grreatoverall set!
Reviews.Author: Robin
Reviews.Content: My research reflected Samsung made some of the best LCD TV's and the research is correct.  Great picture, no bluring on action images, easy to set up and watch!  Price is reasonable and the quality is outstanding.  A definite great choice!

Reviews.Title: our second samsung
Reviews.Author: Sam in New York City
Reviews.Content: We purchased a Samsung 32" set about 5 months ago and have been very pleased with it.  When our kitchen set died, we went looking for another set.  Samsung makes a 22" in white- which filled all our requirements. The only difference between the two sets is that I had to change the factory settings and fine tune it myself.  In the factory presets, the picture left something to be desired.  I matched the settings to our 32" set but it still needed to be adjusted. Once done, the picture is  fine.  We are very happy with both of the sets and would recommend them.

Reviews.Title: One Of Many
Reviews.Author: Frank "Squidder"
Reviews.Content: Based on previous reviewers we have all Samsung TV's and are quite happy and will purchase them in the future. I believe were up to four sets now all purchased through Amazon we are not into high end equipment  and quite honestly tv sucks today and we are watching less and less.

Reviews.Title: Bedroom size
Reviews.Author: Gerrie
Reviews.Content: This product lived up to my expectations.  Been using it several years and think it is just as fine as the day I received it.  I'd buy another Samsung in a minute.

Reviews.Title: Set has loud buzzzzzz
Reviews.Author: James Mcneill
Reviews.Content: Bought the set from Costco - overall I would be quite happy if it did not have a loud buzz - Since it is in a small bedroom and used mainly at bedtime it sounds very loud and annoying. I intend to return it and exchange for the same model.  Good price and thankfully Costco has a great return policy.  If the next set has a similar problem, I'll update this review.Samsung Touch Of Color T220HD 22-inch LCD HDTV Monitor

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money
Reviews.Author: PA STONER "PA STONER"
Reviews.Content: You cant go wrong with this TV.720P is fine, especially with the small screen size.Dont blow your money on the new hype, you will LOVE this TV.If its samsung, you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Sleek, practical tv for a college student
Reviews.Author: Tian C. Jiang
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV because it was my responsibility to bring one to my dorm room. I've mainly used it to watch tv and play video games. Everything is nice, i haven't had problems with it. The sound quality is what you'd expect from a tv though... not very rich. I use my speaker system instead. Overall, far exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV
Reviews.Author: Maria Holmes "Left Coast Photos"
Reviews.Content: As others have said, the sound isn't the best on this television but then, it's a small, inexpensive TV, so one shouldn't expect the same  sound as on units costing ten times as much. I have not tried external speakers but may do so at some point. Other than that, the picture is good. At first we didn't like the pictue much, but we sharpened the picture via the menues, and now the picture is to our liking. The TV scans for new channels much more quickly than our year old set by another maker. Furthermore, the remote is much more ergonomic than our other one. The numbers are on the upper part of the unit. They were on the bottom of our old unit, meaning you couldn't hold the remote in one hand and change the channel with the fingers of that same hand. With this remote, it's possible to do so. Viewing the screen at an angle isn't a problem unless one the screen from almost 180 degree angle. In short, we are very plased with this TV

Reviews.Title: Samsung LCD TV
Reviews.Author: C. Wiese "CW"
Reviews.Content: I've had this tv for about a month now and am very pleased with it's performance.  The picture is much higher quality and the sound is great.  I was working with a specific space size and this one fit the bill.  It was and is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: Samsung TV
Reviews.Author: K. Tabert
Reviews.Content: The picture on this TV is beautiful and it was a great surprise for my boyfriend.  The sound is a little low, but otherwise, it's a great TV.  I based my purchase on the reviews of the product and it is exactly as others described.  Great picture, OK sound. overall - a good value.

Reviews.Title: Very Good but not Perfect
Reviews.Author: Ronald L. Aguirre "rla the great 1"
Reviews.Content: Overall, I liked this TV, it works fine and I like the styling and color.  The only things that I thought needed to be changed are the long time it seems to take to come on after you hit the on button and the strange sound that it makes when you turn it on and off.  Also I don't know why they made it with a black electric cord when the rest of it is white.  It is a very good TV and I am happy with it overall.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Lestifer "Shempie"
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT picture & LOTS of inputs on the back ! I can't think of anything negative to say about this TV.Its lightweight & portable if you want to take it with you in an RV, etc.I highly recommend this TV !!

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN22A450
Reviews.Author: Durene H. Alter
Reviews.Content: The tv came in a timely fashion and in good shape, was easy to install, but does not have the picture quality that I expected after seeing the same model in a store.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 22 -inch Television
Reviews.Author: R. Hahn "Rudi  Hahn"
Reviews.Content: Attractive white TV, excellent picture, very good sound, excellent features, easy-to-follow instruction; which should be followed for best results. A very nice TV, go for it!! Rudi Hahn

Reviews.Title: Nice TV, but with a sound problem
Reviews.Author: Marianne M. Thoen
Reviews.Content: This is the second Samsung HDTV we've purchased in the past 6 months.  The first 37" has been excellent, but this one (22") has a great picture but the sound tends to experience static.  This may be because it is the second set connected to one receiver - we are working on that problem with the satellite provider.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 22"
Reviews.Author: Dennis E. Campbell
Reviews.Content: Comes in slender singular box.  easy assembly in (5) minutes.  Excellent resolution and very little warm up time for the unit to display picture.  Sound quality and speaker position is more than adequate for office, kitchen, bath, RV, etc.

Reviews.Title: Maryanne's Review
Reviews.Author: Maryanne Benane
Reviews.Content: This LCD TV - besides being a great picture and a great size - is perfect for any shabby chic/country cottage type room because it doesn't stick out like a sore thumb - it blends with your decor.  I love it! and actually own 2 of them.

Reviews.Title: Voltage
Reviews.Author: B. B. J. Kalter "baskalter@hotmail.com"
Reviews.Content: Hi, I'm currently stationed in Iraq and we've got 240 volts here. Can any of you guys/gal who bought this screen check for me if it says 110-240 volts on the power adapter? Thank you so much.BBJ Kalter (Dutch for friends)

Reviews.Title: Samsung 22-inch LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Marsha Langaard "Pets galore mama"
Reviews.Content: Samsung LN22A450 22-Inch 720p LCD HDTV, BlackPicture and sound quality are just fine. Size is OK for my small room. Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: great picture
Reviews.Author: Karen Pariseau
Reviews.Content: This LCD TV is in the kitchen, very easy to put on a wall mount. Love the picture. But the speakers are kind of "tinny".

Reviews.Title: Great product with great customer service!
Reviews.Author: Robin
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice TV!  Yes, the sound seems a bit tinny in the beginning, but you get used to it and don't even notice.  (Note: my brother has a 32" Samsung and the sound is not tinny at all.)  The picture quality is fantastic and the remote control is nice.  I am often frustrated with user manuals because they are written so poorly, but not this one; it's well written.  I had to call customer service with a question when I was setting everything up and the agent was helpful, knowledgeable and pleasant and located in the US!  He told me about a shortcut on the remote and even advised me on the best way to hook up my VCR.  I'm tough to please and expect quality in the products I buy.  This one is a keeper!  I'll definitely look to Samsung first for future purchases.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a small space!
Reviews.Author: AMF
Reviews.Content: I love my new TV! It came in a box with a carrying handle, making it very easy to carry up 4 flights of stairs (no elevator in my building). It was even easier to hook up. The delivery was very fast and efficient. I will definitely consider buying another Samsung TV for a larger room (and will definitely use Amazon again.)

Reviews.Title: Best HD picture in my view
Reviews.Author: Robert Markley
Reviews.Content: It didn't occur to be to even look at Samsung TV's until we had a cable service man over to replace our cable box. We asked him if we were to replace our TV, what brand would he suggest. He said he felt that the Samsung line had the best picture of any he has seen. We wanted to explore his suggestion figuring he must see all brands of TV's on his service calls. So I checked out floor models at various electronic stores and found the picture seems to me sharper than the other ones in the store.  I also found the price listed on Amazon was about $100.00 lest than was listed in the stores. The closest retail price occurred when Circuit City was having a going out of business sale and was please that Amazon was still lower.  This 22 inch TV was a birthday present for my wife to replace and old analog one in her home office, and she just loved the sleek black design and the excellent HD picture.

Reviews.Title: Nice small LCD TV
Reviews.Author: GSODA
Reviews.Content: I'm using this both as a TV and a computer monitor.  Perfect size for my use, although for my main TV I still prefer plasma.  I really like Samsung and this is replacing a 17'' Samsung monitor/standard def TV that I have been happy with for years.  I bought this one to get a larger size and the HDTV tuner.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 22
Reviews.Author: SCS "SCS"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv recently and I am very happy with it. The price was the best I found anywhere. Good picture quality, looks nice. Perfect size for our bebroom. I like and recommend this tv. The sound quality is the only thing that is not so great but for the bedroom it's not so bad.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: N. Bozorgnia "Nassim"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV about a month ago, and use it in the living room. It is a very good TV for the price. So far I can get all the free off-air channels (about 40 or so), and I don't have any cable or sattelite.The only downside of the TV is the sound which isn't very loud, but still ok. Depending on the program you are watching, you may even have to put the volume on 100% to hear properly. It may be troublesome for people who have hearing problems, but it is ok for people without hearing problems.I am pretty happy with my choice. But if you can pay a bit more, go for the larger TVs, because the size may be a bit small for larger rooms.

Reviews.Title: Tosheba TV
Reviews.Author: A. Fredrick "alice7day"
Reviews.Content: This is an outstanding TV. After reading some reviews I almost didn't buy this but am so glad I did. My son set it up in a short time and was wowing the picture and features. I looked at it and am doing the same. The picture quality is great as are the features and the ease of set up.

Reviews.Title: Great Bedroom Size
Reviews.Author: Bobbie "Ottergal"
Reviews.Content: The 22" size was perfect for my small bedroom. Great picture. Super-easy to install and set up.

Reviews.Title: Very nice item.
Reviews.Author: C. Apodaca "eshopper"
Reviews.Content: bought this tv for kitchen - white works nicely -picture is really clear - sound is sufficient for use in smaller location - grandma loves it

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: Arlevia S. Powell
Reviews.Content: This is a great HDTV.  Just the right size for the kitchen.  It has an excellent picture and sound.  Also the setup was easy and we had a picture in minutes.  Plan to buy another one for the deck.  Best of all the price was right.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied Observer
Reviews.Author: Clarence P. Siler
Reviews.Content: My new 22 inch Samsung is giving great results, after I got it in the right mode to receive the signal.  The manufacturer would probably tell me to check the directions, but why do that when you can experiment?  We are enjoying it very much and highly recommend it (not mine) to anyone wanting a new tv.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 22 inch LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Barbara
Reviews.Content: Color is beautiful, sound fine if one is just listening to the tv. Haven't tried any add-ons.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for Bedroom
Reviews.Author: Russ
Reviews.Content: I purchased the LN22a450 a week ago and I am totally satisfied with this TV.  I also own a 46 and a 26 inch (LN26a450) Samsung set as well.  I did purchase all three sets from Amazon and let me tell you, service and delivery was top notch.  No issues whatsoever.  The only drawback to the 22" set is the sound and that is easily corrected by selecting the correct sound settings.  I also went with the "movie" settings for the picture and made a few tweaks on my own (recommended by CNET) and everything is awesome.  I also used a peerless pa730 to mount the TV on the bedroom wall.  Talk about a perfect fit and stupidly simple to mount.  The peerless PA730 comes with everything you need and it took 15 minutes to install.  I utilize AT&T; U-Verse HD service and that looks terrific.

Reviews.Title: Cool TV
Reviews.Author: Raschard J. McKinney
Reviews.Content: This TV works excellently. I recommend it for anyone that needs a small TV for a small room and/or for video gaming. The sound could be better but that could always be corrected with enhancements.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 22" LCD TV
Reviews.Author: L. W. Brown
Reviews.Content: The TV was easy to put together, has a fine resolution, and we are very pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: Nice Small TV
Reviews.Author: Catacomb Chris
Reviews.Content: We are currently using this TV in our guest bedroom.  Perfect size TV for a small bedroom or kitchen.  Picture is great, easy to set up, remote is compatible with Direct TV.  We have only had this TV since December 2008.

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: Christa M. Allen "krautone"
Reviews.Content: very nice tv for the bedroom/kitchen.  Great picture and sound is perfectly ok for this size tv.  No faults found and samsung productsspeak for themselves.  Price on this tv at Amazon is a very good buy.Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Daniel R
Reviews.Content: Great brand. Good looks, reliable, stylish. Comments regarding the sound didn't discourage me. There's no way a flat TV is gonna have by itself a powerful sound. That's what home theater speakers are for. Great buy.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for our hearth
Reviews.Author: R. Hodge
Reviews.Content: We have a brick hearth and wanted a small TV to sit on the pedestal portion (we have an electric light fake fireplace so heat is not a problem.  I looked at a number of units and found the Samsung to have the picture I preferred and the price was right.  Amazon delivered promptly and I was set to go in a matter of minutes.  I like the styling with the speakers coming off the bottom which gives it a more compact look.  Ended up buying a 19 inch unit for the kitchen.

Reviews.Title: GaryW
Reviews.Author: Gary M. Willis
Reviews.Content: It works fine. Easy to work. Very good picture. I have a DVD recorder hooked up to it. The interface is no problem.

Reviews.Title: Love this 22"  HDTV
Reviews.Author: Perkasie "roadrunner"
Reviews.Content: We have now owned it one month and love it.  It is perfect in front of our treadmill/dreadmill.  It is mounted on our wall and we are happy with the look.In the next month or two we plan on purchasing another Samsung HDTV, but 46" this time.  Samsung makes excellent products.

Reviews.Title: PRETTY GOOD
Reviews.Author: ms "Quality is Key"
Reviews.Content: I'm satisfied with this buy -- I received what I expected which is good -- the picture quality is good, the sound is good -- the overall look of the tv is good and solid -- I'm happy with my purchase

Reviews.Title: Leo
Reviews.Author: Leo L. Holland
Reviews.Content: The Samsung TV has excellent graphics and was very easy to setup.  I like the HD graphics.

Reviews.Title: Top of the line TV
Reviews.Author: G. Bassett
Reviews.Content: This is the second Samsung HDTV I've purchased. After doing "on line" research, this brand kept going to the top of the lists in best picture, etc. I have enjoyed my earlier big screen (56") model, so I bought this smaller (22") model for my wife's dressing room. She love's it. Nuf said.

Reviews.Title: THIS IS A GREAT TV -
Reviews.Author: Robert L. Rosenkrans
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to replace a CRT type TV that had a really good picture and I was skeptical that the picture would not be as good,  however, in Samsung's tradition,  it has proven to be even better then the CRT picture and  it has good sound that I have heard others complain about.  We use this TV  in our living room which is just right for the size.  A great TV at a great price.

Reviews.Title: Samsung HD TV
Reviews.Author: Dixie Mosher "Jen A"
Reviews.Content: We love our new Samsung HD TV.  The picture is crystal clear.  Great TV.

Reviews.Title: greaqt tv-great price
Reviews.Author: Ronald Smith
Reviews.Content: great tv at a great price-was my first purchase from amazon and my first samsung-bought 2 more this month-am truly a satisfied customer and recommend both amazon and samsung highly-thanks

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN22A451
Reviews.Author: Scott L. Strehlow "Scott"
Reviews.Content: We needed a new tv for the bedroom so we took the 19" Sumsung from the kitchen.  Wife wanted another white tv in the kitchen so we bought another Samsung but got a 22" as the replacement.

Reviews.Title: 22 inch white Samsung TV
Reviews.Author: Mary F. Dickman
Reviews.Content: The television is fantastic.  I only have one small problem with my remote.  When watching something and switching to another channel the remote does not let me go back to original show I was watching.Perhaps I could receive a new remote?Thanks you.Mary Dickman5849 Park Street N. #212St. Petersburg, FL  33709

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
